pinje-portofolio.title: Portofolio

Dark/Light Mode - Seamless theme switching with smooth transitions
Responsive Design - Fully optimized for desktop, tablet, and mobile devices
Modern Tech Stack - Built with Next.js 16, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS v4
Accessible Components - Uses Radix UI primitives for keyboard navigation and screen reader support
Project Showcase - Interactive project gallery with detailed views
Certificate Gallery - Album-style certificate viewer with zoom and navigation
Skills Display - Categorized skills with icons for easy recognition
Experience Timeline - Professional experience and education history

what-to-cook.subtitle: 'What to Cook' is a web-based application designed to help users find recipes based on the ingredients they have.
what-to-cook.description: 'What to Cook' is a web-based application designed to simplify meal planning by providing recipe recommendations based on ingredients you already have. The app aims to reduce food waste, enhance cooking experiences, and make meal preparation effortless for everyone.
features: Ingredient-Based Recipe Search: Enter the ingredients you have to get personalized recipe recommendations.
Save Favorites: Mark and save recipes for quick access later.
Recipe Details: View step-by-step instructions, cooking time, and necessary ingredients.
Dynamic Pagination: Access up to 5 recipes at a time, with smooth navigation.
Responsive Design: Optimized for both mobile and desktop viewing.

about.text: My journey began as a self-taught programmer, and since then, I've been learning and growing through various projects, with a special focus on Frontend Development. Over time, I've expanded into Full-Stack Development and am now deepening my skills in backend technologies and cloud services. Driven by continuous learning and a curiosity for new technologies, I'm always looking for opportunities to take on new challenges and grow as a developer.

frontend: Developed a user dashboard for an internal product platform using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. Implemented features such as product creation, product management, and revenue visualization.
Built the COP30 microsite using Next.js (TypeScript) and Tailwind CSS for Katadata's coverage of the 30th UN climate conference (COP30).
Refactored and migrated asset dependencies for several Shorthand-based longform microsites, including 'Data Center Batam' and 'Hutan Hilang, Sumatra Tenggelam.'
Implemented a registration system for various events using Laravel and MySQL
backend: Developed backend payment using Node.js (TypeScript), PostgreSQL, and Midtrans, and integrated the payment API with the frontend.

description.division: Digital Business and Technology (DBT) - Project: AI Chatbot Builder Platform
frontend: Designed and implemented a real-time Speech-to-Text (STT) feature with Next.js, React, and Tailwind CSS, using WebSocket for live transcription.
Improved the frontend UI by refining the chatbot deletion flow and implementing validation logic for better user experience.
Built and designed a Summary page to visualize chatbot analytics, including token usage and API call outcomes.
Added a document training status indicator UI, allowing users to track the processing status of uploaded documents for topic-specific chatbot training.

Integrated the chatbot appearance settings API into both the frontend dashboard and embeddable iframe, allowing users to easily customize and preview avatar, logo, header color, text color, and welcome message in real time.
backend: Integrated an AI-powered audio/video transcription service by leveraging Python to handle file uploads and retrieve accurate transcriptions via API endpoints.

Built backend services for chatbot appearance customization settings in Node.js, including RESTful APIs using Restify, MongoDB integration, and MinIO for asset management. Wrote unit tests using Mocha for service reliability.
Created API documentation for the ICA project by converting the Postman collection to Excel, then structured and labeled the data to make backend endpoints easier to reference

roles.title: Cloud Computing Cohort
description: Developed a capstone project, Toursantara, an integrated vacation trip planning app aimed at simplifying travel planning. Utilized technologies including JavaScript, Node.js, Docker, Python, and Kotlin, merging elements from Machine Learning, Mobile Development, and Cloud Computing.
Built the back-end, including the server and database for managing destination places & users, and integrated it with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Designed and implemented REST APIs using Hapi.js to facilitate seamless communication between app components.
Deployed the application using Docker, setting up containers and utilizing GCP Cloud Run for efficient cloud deployment.
Assisted in creating comprehensive API documentation to support project maintenance and scalability.

roles.title: React - Beginner Level
description: Developed a responsive web application using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Created a bookshelf application as a final project, and built a note-taking app using React.

roles.title: Dicoding for University 2023
description: Completed a UX case study project, creating user personas and wireframes using Figma, focusing on user-centered design principles.
Learned Agile methodologies, including Scrum and Sprint planning, enhancing project management skills.
Gained foundational skills in SQL for database management.
